sentences.sContent: Fletcher’s superior technique brought him victory.
sentences.sCn: 弗莱彻更胜一筹的技术使他取得了胜利。

sentences.sContent: Don’t you usually salute a superior officer ?
sentences.sCn: 你难道平时不向上级军官敬礼的吗？

sentences.sContent: He had a good working relationship with his immediate superior (= the person directly above him ) .
sentences.sCn: 他和他的顶头上司工作关系很融洽。

synos.tran: 上级的；优秀的，出众的；高傲的
上级，长官；优胜者，高手；长者

remMethod.val: super(在…上面) ＋ ior → 较高的

trans.tranCn: 更好的；职位[级别]更高的；上级的
trans.tranOther: better, more powerful, more effective etc than a similar person or thing, especially one that you are competing against
someone who has a higher rank or position than you, especially in a job
